[p]This device is compatible Bluetooth v2.0 EDR, class 2 (= short range).[/p] [p][b]I am not sure if it work 100 %:[/b][/p] [p]Tested with a 2015's Bluetooth 4 smartphone (Android 5).[/p] [p]- Can connect (appair) from the computer to the bluetooth smartphone.[/p] [p]- Can not connect (appair) from the bluetooth smartphone to the computer.[/p] [p]- Can send a file from the computer to the smartphone.[/p] [p]- Can not send a file the smartphone to the computer (fail to send, does not start file transfert on the smartphone, computer does not show any popup message).[/p] [p][b]Solved[/b]: I had to install "apt://libapache2-mod-dnssd" and setup it (ALT+F2 then type "gnome-file-share-properties") (infos found in [a]http://doc.ubuntu-fr.org/gnome-file-share-properties[/a])[/p] [p][b]lsusb -v[/b][/p] [code] Bus 004 Device 002: ID 0a5c:2121 Broadcom Corp. Requires firmware blob, otherwise works with open-source driver.
This device works out of the box in Debian 8.7.1. It should work with most other libre GNU/Linux distributions without additional setup procedures.

This device supports Bluetooth 4.0, but is backwards compatible with Bluetooth 3.0, 2.1, and 2.0.
